website_summaries.verdict: Small unit works well for several tasks. Includes built-in microphone for hands-free operation on calls.
pros: Easily streams music from any Bluetooth capable device with automatic connections
Audio quality ranks among the best on the market
Simple design that looks natural in the car
cons: Needs a 3.5mm audio input to car stereo

website_summaries.verdict: The Kinivo BTC450 is a good and inexpensive choice for adding Bluetooth to cars with an auxiliary input, but it is short on features.
pros: The Kinivo BTC450 automatically reconnects to previously paired phones
It streams music wirelessly and supports hands-free phone calls
cons: With no internal battery, the Kinivo BTC450 only works when plugged into a car's 12-volt power point
It lacks a display or any internal voice command functions

customer_reviews.title: It's compatibility was a pleasant surprise!
customer_reviews.text: First, I love how easy this was to get working. It's surprisingly nice. I didn't expect for it to be so compatible with Spotify. I drive all day, making multiple stops. I am usually lazy when it comes to doing a series of things over and over (connect to Bluetooth, open Spotify, play a song, etc.). With this I have been listening to music more than ever because you don't have to do anything (as long as Bluetooth is on). Turn off vehicle, music pauses. Turn vehicle back on, music starts again right where it left off! That is bad ass! My 2017 Jeep with Bluetooth doesn't even do that! Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in my car (Mazda 3 2006). I had to crack open the back panel and wire it up properly and the receiver of the device was messed up. If my phone was in standby mode there would be just a light buzzing and cracking in the background but the second my phone would become active it the sound would be equivalent to a fight scene from Transformers. Still not sure if I want to try a different one of these or if I should take my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bluetooth adapter for the car! I haven't had any issues with it and have been using it for a couple of months. Strangely, I seem to prefer the sounds quality of the audio through this bluetooth receiver than directly through the 3.5mm audio cable. Easy to use, just keep it plugged in all the time. Maybe be careful if leaving it plugged into a car outlet that is always powered on as I've looked at my phone hours after I got out of the car in the garage to notice that it's still streaming music to the receiver in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Dave V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for my Toyota Tacoma
customer_reviews.text: Working great on my 2009 Tacoma. I mounted it down by the auxilliary port, on the upper surface of that area and it's out of the way and barely noticeable but easy to reach. It is working perfectly. The only thing it doesn't do which my newer car does is that it doesn't automatically begin to play whatever I was listening to. But that's just a quick push on the center button so no big deal and actually sometimes that is better. No problems connecting with my phone (Samsung Galaxy Note 5) every time. Nice sound quality although I mainly listen to podcasts not music with it so probably not the best judge of that.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas McCain

customer_reviews.title: It works with an old car and an iPhone!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second product from Kinivo and it does not dissapoont. I have a 2012, base model Nissan Versa and an iPhone max- it has been horrible trying to find a product that actually allows me to successfully use Bluetooth in the car with the iPhone. No more “your iPhone may not support this device” garbage. It plugs into the aux cable and cigarette charger (which lets you plug in a usb too) and that it’s. Take a call, listen to your music, talk to Siri- whatever. It works. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: This works better than my built-in car bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I had first purchased this for my previous car which was an '07 and did not have built-in bluetooth. It worked amazing and is very inconspicuous which I loved. When I traded that car in, I left my Kinivo in it because the car I was purchasing was bluetooth equipped. After riding around for several weeks and having the built-in bluetooth disconnect randomly and act completely unreliable, I finally went online and bought my second of these and have been happy ever since. Totally worth it and at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: K. Detwiler

customer_reviews.title: Auto Reconnect Fail
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kinivo I’ve had, I thought the first was just glitchy but put up with it. The second one I bought was very glitchy. By that I mean both Kinivos (especially the second one I bought) did not automatically reconnect, I do it manually. Every time I had a call and took it off speaker for privacy, the Kinivo would not reconnect. I mostly use it to bluetooth my music from my phone to the car speakers and honestly my aux cord has never failed me, the Kinivo fails me on a daily basis. It literally is just a phone charger now.
customer_reviews.author: Truong

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance and excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great, excellent sound quality with AptX, auto-connects, intuitive controls, sleek and unobtrusive. I love it. The only gripe I have is that the voice-control mode (at least with Android) only seems to listen for a few seconds, which is long enough to place a call or play a new track by a different artist, but not long enough to compose a text or use other advanced functions with your voice. Not a deal-breaker for me, but may be for some.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo Beans

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the thing!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I’ve put this unit through the ringer and it’s still alive. Does it’s job really well too, everyone can hear me when I’m on the phone, hey Siri works, music pairs nicely. It will occasionally glitch where I need to unplug it and then plug it back in, but it’s pretty rare. Still giving 5 stars because it’s more loyal and probably lasted longer than the average marriage, and that’s saying something for an electronic device
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works great had to order a noise isolator for whining noise
customer_reviews.text: Love the call and music quality. Was going to return it due to the whining noise that increases with rpm but the noise isolator solved that issue. I would have given it 5 stars but since extra parts needed to be ordered I give it 4 stars. Definitely recommend with isolator in my 2003 Mercedes S55.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought it again!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 3 years ago and it started to short out. Had to buy a replacement because I love the sound quality too much. The handsfree phone calls works well and nobody has any issues hearing me. The sound quality for music is far superior to that of an aux cord and I like the fact it has a USB port for me to plug in my USB c charger
customer_reviews.author: James Griffith IV

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the newer model for my wife after having great success with this one in my own car. The new model didn't work well, really quiet and had to blast volume which then really basted your ears if you switched to the radio, it also meant the sound wasn't as crisp. So, I went back to what I knew worked . . . the BTC450 and it did! Works great, sounds great, etc.!!! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth for my Truck So Far
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple cheaper ones that were also simpler (less wire, etc.), but this one is far better. Functionally it does everything better, but most importantly, the sound during phone calls is WAY better. Cheaper units I just don't sound so good from my end of the call, but with this unit, people on the other end of the call tell me the sound is very good. Everything else works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Butler

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had found one of this adapter a long time ago. Aux cables get warped and the connectors wear out. Other battery powered Bluetooth adapters never last long enough. Because it has a car plug, I never need to worry about that. My aux connection is in the center console, so now I never need to have a cable hanging out of it. I simply leave this thing in there, and it automatically connects to my phone when I start the car. This adapter is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan m anderson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I use the Google Fi Pixel 2XL and my company issued a I(crap) Phone. My headset will not tie into both and I was tired of having two headsets. Plugged into the power outlet on a Tundra unit sits literally right behind the gear shift on Drive. Connects automatically when I get in and turn on the truck. Then it cuts off when you shut off the engine.
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma

customer_reviews.title: Works with issues
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a week now it is a good idea and for an older model car without installed blue tooth it works very well .As a audio only user I almost never receive any phone calls the audio quality as well as a boost in volume over using the Aux port both have improved greatly. I can start the audio with the main button but it refuses to pause or stop the sound when pushed again so that is why I took off a star I was hoping not to have to touch my phone to preform basic operations while driving.I would still recommend even with this fault just for the up bump in overall volume.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoey

customer_reviews.title: All you have to do is plug in to your aux jack as well as the electrical output and pair it up and you are good to go
customer_reviews.text: I have been driving an older car (2010 toyota corolla) and always had my handy dandy aux cable. Nowadays phones are coming out without the aux jack and answering the phone was a pain in the but unless I had a hands free device. The Bluetooth hands free car kit is extremely small about 2.5 to 3 inches in diameter. Its well polished piece of equipment. All you have to do is plug in to your aux jack as well as the electrical output and pair it up and you are good to go. Cant believe I have been driving all these years without it, game changer for older car models.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: you can tell they are in the car but it is much much better than normal speaker phone
customer_reviews.text: works well, when you are in the car obviously calls are played through the speakers so you can hear the other person well, but the other person can hear you quite well also! There is minimal road noise, you can tell they are in the car but it is much much better than normal speaker phone. It is not great with multiple users, it has extra steps to reconnect when the last phone connected was a different one (you have to do it all again like it was the first time). However I would recommend this product! good product, good value.
customer_reviews.author: NP grok

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, no problems
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good solution for vehicles without hands free. Works reliably. Yes there’s dangling cords. Sound is good, automatically connects each time the vehicle is started.
customer_reviews.author: Davs

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Took a star off because the packaging was already opened when I received it. No plastic wrapping around the device and seemed like it was re-packed from a previous return. Other than that, the product itself works great. Paired with my iPhone 6 with no problems and Siri works well by just holding down the center button. However Siri's audio level seems a little low compared to playing music or podcasts, not sure why. Incoming callers sound clear but I haven't asked yet about the quality on the other end. So far, an excellent device to have for your car at a very reasonable price. I'd recommend it to anyone who doesn't have Bluetooth built into their vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: RB68

customer_reviews.title: Great system for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I’m thrilled with how well this unit works. Over the past year I’ve added Bluetooth to all of my home stereo and this was one one last thing that I needed for my 97 S10. It tied in well to the Sony stereo that I have and I have been told the phone calls sound great!! Overall a very positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product, wish it didn’t beep
customer_reviews.text: Amazing option for my car that doesn’t have a bluetooth option for playing music. I’ve had it a few years, and still love it. The sound quality is great. I leave it plugged in all the time, and it immediately connects to my phone as soon as I start the car. For the price, I really love how this thing works. I haven’t really used the voice recognition, maybe once or twice for a call, and it seemed fine. The only negative is that it beeps when you skip to the next song. As someone who skips and shuffles my music a lot, the beep can be loud, high-pitched and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: thebeckert

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing with a passion. Makes a stupid beep everytime you enter the car. No quality. Sometimes it disconnects and you're​ stuck without audio.
customer_reviews.author: Vardan Stambultsyan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my car. Iphone XS and Iphone. Only pet peeve-when you make a call while your music is going via BLUETOOTH and switch to Handset. You have to reconnect the device every time to get back to get the bluetooth connect. I'm not sure why you can't switch back to bluetooth when done with my call. Might be my phone. It's bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disabled my auxiliary jack - maybe permanently. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Toyota Yaris and this disabled my auxiliary jack. Can't tell if this thing worked because the minute I plugged it in, I could no longer change my car over to aux. I'm in the process of returning this, but my aux jack is still a mess - it worked this morning but this evening it still won't change over. I'm pretty upset as the reason I purchased this was because I wanted to play music through my phone without plugging into auxiliary and now I can't even do that. Wish I'd known there was a danger of this...
customer_reviews.author: Meredith A. Short

customer_reviews.title: Running strong for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I have a 2001 car, that doesn't even have an aux in, but I combined this with a tape deck adapter to bring my car up to current technology. Now, every time I get in my car, the bluetooth connects automatically, and I can stream google play music, pandora, or podcasts, and have phone calls automatically pause my music. The microphone works fine for calls, but voice recognition commands don't seem to do so well with the level of background noise in the car. All in all, this was a great deal. It has been running strong for almost two years now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Champ

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the BTC450 along with the Mpow Ground Loop Noise Isolator and the KRIPT HiFi Ground Loop Isolator for Audiophile Low Frequency. Took about (2) minutes to hook up. The output is AMAZING! I was about to purchase a $750 replacement stereo for my 2010 Toyota Tacoma. For $65.00 (Yes $65.00!) I was blown away by the clarity of the output. And it took about 2 minutes to hook everything up. Without a doubt, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: texassports1

customer_reviews.title: Finally a car Bluetooth with buying
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! I have purchased so many blue tooth speakers and devices for my car. Every time I would call someone they could barely hear me and I could only hear them if my car volume was all the way up. This is a small devices that works amazingly! It actually plugs into where the aye cord would go. I love this so much and am very happy I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: RNR

customer_reviews.title: Best blue tooth
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several Bluetooth over the years and all had their own problems. This is by far the best auto hands-free Bluetooth I have purchased. My car has little flat surface to mount things to. The small button allowed me to put microphone close to me. For the first time the person I called could here me clearly even with window open.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Paired to my phone with little to no ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Paired to my phone with little to no fuss! I keep the Bluetooth on my phone activated at all times so when I get in my car and turn it on it automatically pairs with my phone and plays whatever music I was playing or transfers the active phone call onto my car speakers. I have had no complaints about the microphone quality at all. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: primo1289

customer_reviews.title: it's great. What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's great. What I wanted: a music only bluetooth device, please don't force me to use the speakerphone. What I got: the Kinivo sends the ringtone to the speakers, but if you answer on the phone instead of the button on the Kinivo, it behaves normally without using the speakers and Kinivo microphone. Answer with the Kinivo button, and you get speakerphone. I wish this was in the product description or literature. Happy so far. Like another reviewer, I also do not like the LED flashing every 10 seconds or so, but that will be remedied with a marker or tape.
customer_reviews.author: GarthNotBrooks

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Easy Set up
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 04 BMW 330i, and it works perfect. Sound Quality is GREAT, way better than an FM transmitter. I would definitely recommend this if you have a aux +cigarette hole near eachother. I put it in other cars for road trips, but if the aux + cigarette hole arn't near eachother, it might not be worth it to use this set up. Also if you don't have an aux connection in your car, and are using a fm transmitter for the aux connection, that also works for the bluetooth connection, however sound quality is still bad because it is based off of the fm transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: CoconutBank

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our vehicle!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's Chrysler Pacifica because I didn't want to remove her factory system but wanted to add Bluetooth music playback capabilities to the vehicle. I mounted it it on the dash right next to the ignition and it works well - calls are clear and the skip buttons are handy when listening to music. The only issue I had was with the 1.5mm headphone output jack - the factory radio has RCA inputs instead of a 1.5mm input, so I had to buy an adapter to make it work (not really Kinivo's fault). Other than that, no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: kjbad

customer_reviews.title: 4 years flawless working
customer_reviews.text: It has been 4 years since i got this gizmo and still works AWESOME, Super clear transmision of Spotify from my cell to my head unit Without bluetooth, calls are crystal clear, i just wonder with such small device and such amazing quality why head unit manufacturers charge so much for a simple bluetooth module? For this guys at Kinvo Hats off for an amazing product, even if stop working today i would by another right away without thinking,. Get it you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J.

customer_reviews.title: This thing does Voice calls like expected, I'm having trouble getting it to do ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing does Voice calls like expected, I'm having trouble getting it to do music, but that may be a phone issue, but the phone does work with bluetooth headset listening to music, since it hasn't been purely simple I'll take a star, but if your looking for voice calls through a car with a aux port, this will do it well enough. I like that there's a usb port for charging in the plug for it, I dont know how fast it is but it does work. I like that when you plug it in it turns on, no pairing to force or anything, I paid full price for it, and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: R. France

customer_reviews.title: entirely stopped working 6 months in
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great the first few months. After about four months, sound / music came in less and less clear, then completely garbled. Last week, it stopped working entirely. Troubleshot the issue (restarted my phone's bluetooth, disconnected and reconnected the bluetooth device, tried it in different aux power outlets, etc.). No luck, product no longer even turns on when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sanderlin

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2009 Pontiac G8 and the car with its low profile tires is not exactly quiet on some of these Idaho roads. However, I must say after trying several Bluetooth options, this Kinivo is by far the best one we have used. I can hear the girlfriends voice clearly at any speed and there is minimal background noise. I would tell everyone for their money, this product is worth it and I would not hesitate to purchase again; which I am thinking of doing so. If it helps but should not matter, my girlfriend has an iPhone 6 and I have a Galaxy S6. They do have the updated Bluetooth systems.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Sound can be a little less than desirable. I am told it sometimes sounds a little odd and that I am talking through the old can on a sting type sound. If I ever need another I would buy again because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: JBrookie

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, effective.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My 2k8 Acura has HFL for calls but I was using the aux in cable for playing music and podcasts. Someone in an internet forum had a similar situation as well and recommended this to me as a solution. Set up easy and paired to my Pixel XL right away. Haven't done much more than test it but I'm already happy to know there is a kit like this to solve a long standing problem I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Spring

customer_reviews.title: Look no Further!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This unit allows hands-free call answering in non-Bluetooth equipped vehicles that have an auxiliary input on the factory stereo. Set-up took less than a minute. It also has buttons that allow you to skip forward or backward, or pause music playback without touching your phone, even while using your navigation. The included microphone provides a clearer voice to the other caller than your phone does while on speakerphone. A must buy for those with an older vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any car without Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: Must have for any car without Bluetooth. - It uses AptX so sound quality is fantastic. - The buttons are nice, can skip or pause songs without having to touch the phone. - Center button can be used for voice commands - It also doubles as a phone charger with an extra USB port. The only issue i have encountered was a slight static noise, but that's an issue with the car. If you have this problem buy a "ground loop isolator" and plug it between this unit and the car, and it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vishal Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but the cord broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: As a solution for my bluetooth connection for my car, I tried this product. I do not know much about its various capabilities, I can only say that it served its purpose: to connect my phone to the stereo via bluetooth, where I mainly listen to music and conduct phone calls. As far as use goes, I found it very streamlined. It had very few options, but could switch to the next song and answer the phone easily. Since then, I've found that other products have more options. It wasn't long before the wires in the cord broke (after about a month of use). For this reason, I stopped using this car kit and bought the more expensive Belkin option.
customer_reviews.author: K8Ness

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Will pair automatically when I get into a vehicle, which is a must. The middle button for playing/pausing/connecting is nice. The button on the top for skipping/repeating the track is great as mine sits on the center console, like a jog dial. Works like an OEM bluetooth unit, which is what I was looking for. A lot better than the other in-car bluetooth junk that promises certain features but in real life does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my driving teen.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughters Highlander, and it works well. I hear her, she hears me. A bit tinny but not much. Also purchased the noise cancelling adapter. overall couldn't ask for for much more, does what it is supposed to do now that GA has the hands free law. The press of a button and she has so much control over her phone and music. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sambelle2

customer_reviews.title: Connects to my phone when I turn on the car!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Haven't had any trouble with it at all. Hands-free. Turns on when I turn the car on (I have it plugged into my 12 volt charger), and automatically connects to my Pixel 2 XL phone via Bluetooth, so I don't have to push any buttons. 👍 High quality sound if I play music from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Proleshi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, auto connects to the last device when you start the car. The sound is much better than expected-better than when I run my phone through the AUX jack. My only concern is that wiring doesn't seem as though it is very sturdy(may just be appearances). When mounting, make sure wires are tucked away where there is little chance of them getting snagged on something. My AUX jack is in the center console, so I have the receiver in there too. Connects to my phone every time. Definitely recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: TJO

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fair price...happy customer! :)
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for about 2 years in my car. I think it works really well and I can truly do hand-free operation for just about anything I need to on my nearly 2 hour commute each day. The other thing is that it looks like it "fits" in the car. I have it near the radio of my Prius and many people have commented that it looks like it came with the car (minus the small cable running out of the bottom of course). I purchased this for my mother as she just got an iPhone, and she loves it as well!
customer_reviews.author: Chris MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money complete disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It connect right when you turn on the car but it sounds horrible and the distortion caused when no music is playing is even worse, what makes the noise even more of a let down for this product is the fact that when a "soft" song is playing you can hear the loud screech in the background I tried giving the item a try for more than a week now and the noise is just not bearable. Kinda mad at myself for throwing the box away I would've just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad and it works great! his car doesn't have bluetooth and NH is going hands free this summer so we needed a solution. This was about $30 less than the Belkin one, and compared to other reviews, it out performs it as well. The sound quality is great and you can't even tell it's a third party bluetooth. Honestly, it works better than the bluetooth system I have in my 2009 Acura. Added bonus, you can also play music through it! The cord isn't crazy long, so if your AUX port is in your center console, I would invest in a longer adapter than what comes in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Great product, it does exactly as is advertised but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it does exactly as is advertised but doesn't always automatically connect when I get back into the car. Don't get me wrong, it usually does connect but occasionally I have to either manually connect or disable then enable it. I don't think this is an issue with my phone because I have seen the same thing happen with my wifes. I would still happily purchase this product and really like the simple yet not over simplified controls of a single main button and then a couple back and forward buttons to change tracks. I found the mic of decent quality and could easily use it while driving quickly on the highway with the window shut.
customer_reviews.author: Antal Mak

customer_reviews.title: Quick install and works great
customer_reviews.text: Installation was extremely easy. I purchased an Mpow ground loop isolator for good measure and installed it in series with the audio. Fifteen minutes after beginning the install I was finished and my phone synced up immediately. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy and quick to install and works awesome
customer_reviews.text: This was the most simple and quick device to install and set up. It took just a matter of a couple of minutes. It works great in my 2011 car. I am buying another one for my daughter because this thing works so great
customer_reviews.author: B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth adapter works exactly as expected. Easy to set up and with hidden features that I frankly wasn’t expecting. Put your auxiliary jack to good use and add the Kinivo BTC450. You know you want your older car system to have Bluetooth. I love this product so much that when I needed another adapter I bought this model again. You won’t regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: David Demarest

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bluetooth connection with a low profile!
customer_reviews.text: Got this based on the good recommendations and am not disappointed. Haven't used the voice recognition feature so can't comment. After owning and using for about 7 months I can say... Pros -unit is small -wire is tiny making it easy to conceal -never lose when driving -auto off and auto connection -mic on the unit works really well for calls Cons -unit after taking phone calls thru the phone's speaker doesn't reconnect have to unplug the unit and plug back in for it to reconnect, small annoyance. -thats really it.
customer_reviews.author: Danson

customer_reviews.title: This product was an excellent purchase. It does a great job placing calls
customer_reviews.text: This product was an excellent purchase. It does a great job placing calls, playing music, and it even works with Siri and Google now. It automatically reconnects to the last phone paired to it, so this can be an issue if you want to use multiple phones with it. The other thing I wish it had was the option to add a password to it so that other people don't accidentally connect to it. I have had it fail to automatically reconnect a couple of times and I imagine that this is because someone tried to connect to it since it stays on even when my car is off. This is a wonderful product and is extremely convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bluetooth solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best car bluetooth interface I've ever used. EASY setup, simple to pair, pairs automatically on startup (after initial setup). Sound quality is great. If you can, mount the button higher up in the middle of your dash, in an unobtrusive but easy to reach spot. I love that I can quickly just tap the button to pause audio playback. SO handy. I have put 3 of these in cars and I really hope they don't stop making these. Nothing else on the market compares.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lindeberg

customer_reviews.title: Bad connection, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this unit for over 3 years and the sound quality is the only reason I put up with its downfall. The downfall: cannot keep connection from one day to the next. When it connects regularly it easily takes at least 30 seconds sometimes a full minute. But like I started with the sound quality is by far the best. Used in a 2015 Chevy Impala.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from Orlando, FL

customer_reviews.title: fired up Spotify to test it out and it worked fine. I left home a short time later for ...
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived, I paired it with my new Pixel 2, fired up Spotify to test it out and it worked fine. I left home a short time later for the evening and it paired automatically when I started the car, but five minutes down the road, the next/prev buttons would no longer skip tracks. Turning Bluetooth off and back on didn't fix it, nor did removing and re-pairing the device, so I gave up after a while. When I headed home, it no longer paired automatically and completely refused to pair at all through multiple attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Nelson

customer_reviews.title: 5 years going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this installed on my car for about 5 years and it's been amazing. As soon as I turn my car on this Bluetooth will power up and connect to my phone every single time. I've owned android and iPhone with no issues. When I installed mine I got a bad feedback... But I bought a relay to plug in the aux before plugging the kinivo in and it resolved the issue. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to wanting the back and forward buttons for my music control. I had previously though my old bluetooth adapter sounded pretty good until I tried this one. Wow, what a difference. I can hear no difference between this and a direct wired connection. It powers on when the car is turned on and powers off when the car is off. This with an auto connect and play app on my phone makes for an effortless connection to my music. The hands free works great too, though I don't expect to use it much. I also like the shape and ability to stick it right next to my car's stereo for easy reaching.
customer_reviews.author: B Square

customer_reviews.title: Love it, so easy to install, even a cave man can do it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product. Just plug and play. All you have to do is plug 2 wires in and you're done. If you were handy, I'd pop out some plastic and tuck the wires in, but other then that, it's as simple as it can be. only gripe I have is that the wires are really thin, so a good tug might rip the wires. If you're careful with that, it's a good product. Money well spent. Just make sure you have an Aux input port, and a working cig port. The USB charging port isn't that great, so if you have the option to have it plugged in a 2nd cig lighter socket, do so.
customer_reviews.author: Joon

customer_reviews.title: Saved me the cost of replacing the factory radio
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so useful. I set my phone up with the app 'Bluetooth Connect and Play', and it now automatically starts my favorite music app as soon as I start the car. I can leave my phone in my pocket and just use the buttons on the Kinivo. Sound quality is excellent. And as a bonus you get a USB charger adapter. I was shopping for new car radios for the sole purpose of adding BT. I didn't want to loose some of the factory functions and look. This adapter gives me the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best quality Bluetooth kit you'll find on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Kinivo in my car for months, and it is just AWESOME! It's easy to install and is made with quality. It's not obtrusive to my car set up, and the design is simple. It has one large button, used to start/pause, and then two skip buttons on the side. It's become part of my life routine, and I highly suggest this Bluetooth kit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth I've used!!
customer_reviews.text: Best aux bluetooth I've used and I've tried a lot. Easy to mount and managed to stay in place through a hot southern California summer. Easily pairs to my phone and plays music that sounds as good as a built in bluetooth. Music sounds great! Would have given 5 stars, but a lot of background noise can be heard on the opposite calls end. Especially while driving on the freeway. Probably due to the mic being too far away. But due to the fact that this is corded, there isn't a close spot to put it. Even with that small issue I would still recommend it and purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: And

customer_reviews.title: This is the best product I have bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product I have bought on Amazon. I do not usually write reviews but I feel I need to write a stellar review for this because I bought this product over 5 years ago and it is still working like it was brand new out of the box. I use it everyday and it has been connected in my car since day 1. It has endured the heat/cold and it has always worked with great sound quality with no static like the FM transmitter. It is like you are connected through an auxilory cord (which it kind of is). Love it and will buy another one when this one dies, if it ever does.
customer_reviews.author: gilbert concepcion

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Works alrighty. Sometimes have to unplug it and then plug it back in before hitting the button to get it to connect, otherwise nothing. I like it though and it works for me. The sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first there were some technical issues - first item was defective - but the manufacturer promptly responded to my request for assistance - I received a replacement under warranty. The replacement device was much better. The set up was easy, the connection was stable however for improved sound and noise reduction - it is recommended that you get a ground loop isolator - I purchased the PAC SNI-1/3.5 3.5-mm Ground Loop Noise Isolator . This device pairs easily with multiple devices and and connects each time. Kudos to the manufacturer for supporting the issues and getting me the replacement device really quick. Easy set up - good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: tech

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has by far been the BEST purchase I have ever made on Amazon. It's incredibly easy to use and very convenient. The best part is that it's very affordable yet the quality of it is great. I waited a long time to review it because I wanted to see how long it would last. So far it has never failed me and it doesn't look like it's going to stop working any time soon. I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device!! I drive an older model Silverado that does not have hands free built in to the stereo system. This device plugs into the AUX jack on my factory stereo and provides clear, crisp broadcast of phone calls and music (Pandora) from my phone through the stereo. I Placed the unit approximately near the middle of the dash so Either my passenger or I can be easily heard by the caller. Noise cancelling works very well as I have had no complaints about background noise. I have had no issue with Bluetooth signal noise/interference. Lastly, it is a low profile design that is not at all obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Sounds bad
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about a month of owning it. Sound humming and static during play. With these sort of devices I think you have to get the more expensive ones if you want the sound quality to be good, this apparently wasn’t expensive enough....
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Used this product in my work van where there is always noise around, people on the other end of the line hear me without any difficulty and the ability to put this through the speakers let me hear them without any problems. I also liked that it streams my music and podcasts, I was using headphones and earbuds but always had the problem of getting my vans background noise and difficulty hearing when my volume was turned up to full. I have had this product for 2 weeks and was wondering why I didn’t purchase it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Francis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I 'installed' this on my 2011 Mazda Miata which has a 1/8" audio-in jack. Installation is a piece of cake - essentially you plug it into the audio-in jack, plug it in to the power plug, and figure out a place to stick it on your dash. Since I installed it, it has been absolutely bulletproof. Audio is clear, it starts up properly each time the vehicle starts, play/pause works as intended. Sometimes things completely meet your expectations - this is one of those times - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TJW

customer_reviews.title: So simple and it works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: This works extremely well. Sound is clear and the call quality is good on both ends. This is less expensive and much better than the sun visor units I've used. Pandora works great as well. I peeled the sticker off the adhesive pad and set this just under my instrument cluster to the right of the steering wheel, plugged it in and paired it to my phone. Done. It has been working flawlessly since. I was hesitant because I didn't recognize this brand but this is a quality unit. When it comes to electronics and especially cell phone accessories I find that they either work great or are simply horrible. This is a hit. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GLM

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly With My iPhone 5
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to, hopefully, eliminate my $200+ annual subscription to Sirius XM. My car has an AUX port, but does not have bluetooth, so thought I'd give this little contraption a whirl. First, setup was a snap. I had it out of the package and installed in my vehicle in under 5 minutes. Now, I can stream Pandora, iHeartRadio, iTunes Radio, etc., and NOT pay an annual subscription. And the bonus is that I can take and make hands-free calls without ever touching my phone. The sound quality is fantastic... can't tell any difference between Pandora and the quality of sound I was getting with my Sirius subscription. Fantastic product!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen G

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive with a good quality sound
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget has been a great addition to my older (in great condition) daily driver vehicle. Easy to install and connects to my iPhone with ease. Was thinking about purchasing a new radio however with this device I saved money and still have the wonderful features of hands free and bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this hands free
customer_reviews.text: Love this hands free. I've been waisting money on expensive ones like Jabra, and kept getting frustrating because they will disconnect while I'm driving. This one connects to the phone as soon as you enter the car, and you can make louder by the radio knob. You don't have to take your eyes off the road for a second. Also you don't have to remember to charge in advance. I waited about two months before writing this review because I was not sure if it will really work considering the price. I've paid $70 for for each Jabra and I was disappointed. This one is great. Installation is easy, and connection is easy. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabina

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This item worked for approximately five days. First, the plug for the extension stopped working; it wouldn't conduct the sound to the speakers in my car at all. Then, I tried to use it without the extension & no sound would emit from my car speakers unless I had the car radio on maximum volume. That was a pain if I forgot to turn down the volume when I unplugged this item. Even with the volume turned all the way up in the car & on my phone, the sound was audible but still very low for regular use (competing with road noises). This all happened within the first week of owning this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Prius (iPhone & Samsung Phones)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Prius that wasn't equipped with Bluetooth. We plugged it into the cubbie where USB and AUX is located and stuck the multi-button right by the Cupholder on the dashboard. Easy to sync and setup, You can sync upto 6 phones. Audio quality is great. My hubby travels a lot for work, or just needs to talk to family on his long commute, so definitely keeping us hands-free. We have not changed any settings or tinkered with it at all, after initial setup. Just works everytime (Bluetooth is usually left ON on our phones anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Rushkami

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and auto connects without interaction
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for, a device that auto-connected each time and did not require any interaction to do so. Also I feel like the sound is pretty good and you do not hear any electrical feedback which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great product-installed easily into Cadillac CTS (plugged the cable into ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product-installed easily into Cadillac CTS (plugged the cable into the audio-in jack located in center console to the right of the driver). Circular part easily stuck to dash. Paired easily as "BTC450". Call came in, I pressed the center circle and the call came through the speaker system....crisp and clear. I ended the call by pressing the center circle again - easy. I redialled the last call easily too. Highly recommended with additional product "PAC SNI-1/3 3.5 -mm Ground Loop Noise reducer".
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I found this an excellent Bluetooth option
customer_reviews.text: I have a GMC Sierra 1500 with a bench seat. I did not have any AUX input on the dash, my only option was the fold down center console on the seat. In that compartment there was a AUX input as well as a power source. I placed the microphone on top of the center compartment. I didn't think that having the microphone down that low and a little behind would work well but I was wrong. The product worked as advertised. I have no static and people that call me say that they can hear me loud and clear. Music also comes through very clear. I found this an excellent Bluetooth option.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues up front just trying to get all of my devices to sync correctly, but customer service was extremely helpful, and this guy works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product works with no issue plugs up to cigarette lighter never runs out of battery because no battery is used. Sounds better with my Android phone, not as good of sound from my iphone
customer_reviews.author: taburch

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love this little Button!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I am all about wireless everything, but sadly my 2011 Honda is not quite up to speed with Bluetooth tech yet. Have no fear though, this little baby is all you need. My roommate has a Mini Cooper with Bluetooth functionality built in and the speakerphone is terrible. I paid $35 for this and get easy setup, it connects easily every time I use it, and you get crystal clear audio, both for music and speakerphone. If you don't have Bluetooth in your car or the built-in Bluetooth sucks, I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Gift for daughter
customer_reviews.text: She uses in her Jeep Wrangler. Jeeps are noisy & tire sound is loud. She love this & uses it daily. She had no issues connecting phone via Bluetooth. She said sound quality even in her Jeep is good.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sosebee

customer_reviews.title: Great for music, Ok for calls
customer_reviews.text: The music quality through my truck speakers is just like if I were plugging my ipod in through the system. Bass, Mids, and Highs come through great. Call quality is a different story. I can hear people just fine, but I get a lot of "what?" and "say that again" when I'm talking through the Kinivo vs. using the actual phone. I've tried placing it a foot from my mouth, even taking it off and talking straight into the Kinivo, but haven't had any luck making the receiving end understand me any better. I can communicate with people, but there are times when I have to repeat myself.
customer_reviews.author: janesvillite

customer_reviews.title: Might have poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: It works but sounds staticky. When there’s silence between tracks it sounds worse. I submitted a return because it might be the item itself. Unfortunately I forgot to return it and the return window closed 3 days ago. So now I’m stuck with an item I will not use. Like I said it can be the unit I received or they all have the same staticky sound. I guess I will never know.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but lacks quality
customer_reviews.text: For me to hear audio clearly I had to turn the volume on my phone and car speakers rather high. The louder I made the volume the amount of static heard also increased. While making calls I was told I sounded choppy and distorted. Using my phones speaker function resulted in better quality than that of this product. I had high hopes for this product based on other reviews. I received a replacement product directly from the manufacturer and did not have any luck with the replacement product, so I refuse to believe I had the unfortunate "luck" of receiving two faulty units.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bengtson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first month but now it’s dead. Hasn’t been moved from the car. Just doesn’t turn on anymore. The USB port on it works to charge but the Bluetooth unit itself has died. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Rgeezy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Automatically connects - Great sound (unless you're a true audiophile) - Stylish design - Forward/Back buttons so I don't have to use my phone - Works with Spotify on a Windows Phone Cons: - Need to yell my commands (I put this near the gear box) - Sometimes music does not play after receiving a text (haven't figured out if I'm doing something wrong here..this is the only reason I'm giving it four stars) - Play button doesn't automatically start my music when I first get in the car. This is likely a limitation of my phone though
customer_reviews.author: wc

customer_reviews.title: but as soon as he connected it he was super excited. He says that the range on it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother. When it arrived at his house he first was confused as to what it was, but as soon as he connected it he was super excited. He says that the range on it is very good. He has an iPhone and he can be in another part of the house with his phone and it works perfectly. That's about a 30 foot range, plus going through walls. The only bummer is that it should come with an off button. He has to physically unplug it when he is done. Another great product from Kinivo.
customer_reviews.author: M Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I'm now living in a hands-free state. Wanted something to keep playing my iPhone music through my stereo, get directions and, if necessary, make a phone call as wireless as possible. This is perfect! Worked unbelievable for a 7 hour car ride and people have not mentioned any difficulty in understanding me when talking on the hands-free phone. Every now and then it gets a bit hissy when the phone is not connected, but unplug and re-plug power and it's just fine. also I have this installed on my dash and I think it's meant to be installed upside-down, so the forward/reverse buttons for the music are flipped, but work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Conlon

customer_reviews.title: Lots of noise and static over the speakers.
customer_reviews.text: First, this is definitely over priced. It's about $5 worth of plastic and electronics. Second, when paired with any device I have, it has no filter so a lot of static comes over the speakers. This is pretty normal when you don't filter and use a car lighter for power but this was the worst I've heard from a device. Finally, the volume controls were very strange with my android devices. Don't recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: corey l

customer_reviews.title: this is a great way to go
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought one of these years ago. If you have an Aux-in on your car and want Blutooth, this is a great way to go. Calls are clear and the music from my iPhone is better than the direct connection I used to use. My phone could be in my back pocket, or my backpack, I'll start the car and after a few seconds hear the little *bloo-bleep* and I know it's synched. Then I just press the bug, friendly grey button glued behind my steering wheel, and my playlist resumes where it left off whether I was listening to iTunes, Pandora, or Amazon Prime; just picks up where I left off. Very slick. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product with a good cost
customer_reviews.text: I have a Civic 2008 and unfortunately the sound doesn't have bluetooth. I bought this device because I wanted to use the sound system to operate as hands-free device. The device is easy to use: just plug and it's working! One point goes into the charger and the other in the audio input of the sound system. Activate the bluetooth in your phone and sync with the device. It's done! You can use the bluetooth conection to play music (with controls on the device) or to attend the phone calls. The mic is very good (you don't have to yell) and to attend the call you just need to press the button. Very happy with the device!
customer_reviews.author: Artur Higashiyama

customer_reviews.title: Great nice solution.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. The only problem i found is that sometimes when i turn on my iPhone 5S bluetooth And press synck button... Beeps as synchronized but MUSIC reproduce through iphone's speakers so i unplugg And re-plug the Kinivo energy And synks again And everything is fine. No Big deal. I have a 2010 Ford escape And the Kinivo button placed just aside flash light button. The energy cord i extended under the Plastic trim from steering column through radio panel until reach cigarrete lighter. VERY neat.
customer_reviews.author: JCDarquea

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sounds great and connects perfectly every time
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sounds great and connects perfectly every time. I've used other Bluetooth products and reverted back to a wired connection due to connection issues. This product pairs up quick and connects perfectly every time. The music sounds fantastic and the speakerphone is very good too. Works better than the $400 Parrot setup in had in my previous car. There are some reviews complaining about reliability. With the one year warranty, at this price point, it is not only worth every penny, but you can buy 10 of them for the cost of one Parrot, giving you a minimum 10 years of warrantied use.
customer_reviews.author: nys464

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it turns on instantly and pairs with my smart phone when I start my car. I hated my previous product where I had to start my car and then manually hold a start button for 5 seconds to pair with my phone -- annoying. Also, my previous product had a 'hizz' noise - I guess it was due to lack of grounding or something, but not this product - no 'hizz' noise what so every. This product delivers very high quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: unikut

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play BT audio and speakerphone
customer_reviews.text: These are the easiest to use for cars with an aux jack. The sound quality is the best I have found and pairing with my phone is quick the first time, then automatic thereafter. Hands free phone for my kids makes me feel better as well.
customer_reviews.author: L Knight

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but....
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and great price BUT! your car's power system may mess with the setup and produce an annoying whinning sound. To fix it I had to buy this ( for an extra $12 which fixed the whinning issue instantly and made the Kinivo great. My suggestion is that you buy the Kinivo first, try it and if you get a whining sound through the speakers THEN buy the ground loop noise isolator since your car's electrical system might not have the same effect. Best solution would be for Kinivo to have a group loop isolator built into the next version of their adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Ferretti Jr.

product_meta.title: Kinivo BTC450 Bluetooth Car Kit (Hands-Free Adapter for Cars with 3.5mm Aux Input, Apt-X)
feature_bullets: Hands-Free car kit designed for answering and receiving calls with any Bluetooth smartphone - iPhone, Android, Blackberry etc
Seamlessly stream music from any Bluetooth (A2DP) capable device; supports aptX for CD quality audio
Requires 3.5mm audio input in the car stereo. Built-in microphone and easy to use music controls
Provides audio through your 3.5mm input in Car Stereo when playing music and answering phone calls
Two-year warranty with lifetime US based customer support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars9,046 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
